member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsMp4FastStartEnabled
member.summary: Place the mp4 header at the start of the file. This makes the playback start faster when streaming. This option is only available when recording to a stream.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsHardwareEncodingEnabled
member.summary: Enable hardware encoding if available. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsLowLatencyEnabled
member.summary: Faster rendering, but can affect quality. Use when speed is more important than quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsThrottlingDisabled
member.summary: Disable throttling of video renderer. If this is disabled, all frames are sent to renderer as fast as they come. Can cause out of memory crashes.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.IsFixedFramerate
member.summary: Send data to the video encoder every frame, even if it means duplicating the previous frame(s). Can fix stutter issues in fringe cases, but uses more resources.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.IsMousePointerEnabled
member.summary: Display the mouse cursor on the recording
